definition: to be cocky
to stick up/to rise on one end/to tilt
outstanding/to raise
tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish
horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail

sentences.english: Don't get cocky when you've achieved something.
That's why the Rightists are so cocky.
You see a Quaker can flatter, but don't you be proud.
sentences.chinese: 你看，贵格会教徒也会奉承人了，但你可别翘尾巴呀。

sentences.english: We should never become arrogant and cocky.
sentences.chinese: 我们永远不能骄傲，不能翘尾巴。

definition: to think highly of oneself
(dialect) to be cocky/smug/to show off
immensely pleased with oneself (idiom)/proud/complacent
lit. a vile character flourishes (idiom)/fig. an inferior person gets into a position of power, becoming conceited and arrogant
variant of 得瑟[de4 se5]
to tuck one's tail between one's legs/fig. to back down/in a humiliating situation
see 耍滑[shua3 hua2]
to put on airs/to be ostentatious
lit. to climb all over sb/fig. to take advantage of sb's weakness
(of mules, horses etc) to kick backward/to kick with the hind legs/fig. to flare up in anger/to display defiance
immeasurably self-satisfied
(coll.) to show off
to show off one's accomplishments (often derog.)
pekingese (dog)/(fig.) sycophant/lackey
to get smart/to resort to petty tricks
toady/bootlicker
